questions.text: While creating the world, what did God do on day seven?
questions.explanation:
Rest & Rested.

	In Genesis 2:2, it says 'God ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made'.

questions.text: In the 2003 movie "Lucky 7", who played Amy Myer?
questions.explanation:
Kimberly Williams-Paisley.

	When Amy's mother wrote out the rest of Amy's life on a time line, Amy Myer (Kimberly Williams-Paisley) followed her mother's plan exactly. Then Amy met Peter.

questions.text: "The Seventh Son" is a play about Tupac Shakur?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	"The Seventh Son" played in Alexandria, Virginia on February 9th through the 20th of 2000 and was written by Kwame Alexander. It was about the life and death of Tupac Shakur.

questions.text: Which movie star played in the 1955 movie, "The Seven Year Itch"?
questions.explanation:
Marilyn Monroe.

	Marilyn Monroe plays the girl that Richard Sherman conjures up in his imagination to help him get through the summer while his wife and son are away.

questions.text: In Chemistry, what element has the atomic number of seven?
questions.explanation:
Nitrogen.

	The atomic number of an element is defined as the measure of the charge on an atom's nucleus by adding up the total number of protons it contains.

questions.text: What is the first note of the seven note musical scale?
questions.explanation:
Do.

	There are seven sounds in the musical scale: Do-Re-Mi-Fa-So-La-Ti.

questions.text: What is not one of the seven deadly sins?
questions.explanation:
Shopping.

	In the Catholic church, Pope Gregory the Great listed the seven deadly sins as gluttony, wrath (anger), pride, sloth, lust, greed, and envy.

questions.text: Brad Pitt starred in the movie called 'Seven Years in _____'.
questions.explanation:
Tibet.

	Brad Pitt was banned from China after playing the real life man, Heinrich Harrier, the Austrian mountain climber who met the Dalai Lama just when China was taking over Tibet. The real life sister of the Dalai Lama, Jetsun Penna, played the Dalai Lama's mother in the movie.

questions.text: Jonathan LaPaglia starred in a show called "Seven Days" where he traveled back in time seven days to prevent disasters. What TV station originally aired "Seven Days"?
questions.explanation:
UPN.

	"Seven Days" originally aired on UPN from October 1998 to May 2001. Besides Jonathan LaPaglia, the show starred Justina Vail (Highlander) and Don Franklin (SeaQuest).
